body.p: His Excellency James F Robinson, Governor of Kentucky, Your petitioners would respectfully state, that James H. Hart is sentenced to be hung on Saturday the 18th July -- that until this 14th of July he had hopes that an appeal would be granted -- that the time is now so short that he will have little chance to prepare for his final and terrible doom. We respectfully ask you to respite his punishment for thirty or sixty days or such time as your Excellency may deem proper.

Gov Robinson -- I have acted as the spiritual adviser of Mr Hart, he seems to be Earnestly seeking a preparation for deft. I dont think he is prepared; as yet, for that to act & dont know that he ever will be but I would be glad to have a longer time to direct his mind

Wm M. Peates
Jno B Norton C F C C
Chas C Lowry D C

J. M. Elliott (Jury Man)
The man has but four days left the court of appeals held this matter up strangely -- if you can extend the term upon Mr Pratts statements the poor fellow may make some preparation to die.
Respite granted in this case until 1st August 1863

Fayette Cir. Ct
Jas H. Hart
Murder
Issd July 14th 1863.
